channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bushes overhanging more than half the pavement, 12th December
item.description:
The overhang belongs to No1 Castlefields Avenue anr run along Castlefields drive has been like it for a long time

item.title: Abandoned diversion sign, 12th December
item.description:
Reported this a few weeks ago along with some abandonded cones on New Road. The cones were removed but this diversion sign is still there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Green, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hand rail vandalised, 12th December
item.description:
The handrail has been vandalised making the steps extremely dangerous on the footpath from upper lnnsworth lane to lower innsworth lane. This was reported back in November but no action has been taken!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Markings almost invisible in wet weather, 12th December
item.description:
The entire road between Prestbury and Southam has very poor road markings. This is extremely dangerous this time of year as I see drivers struggling to see the lines and will slow down when oncoming traffic is approaching. When wet, the markings are almost invisible in the glare.It would also be great if they could be parked at the edges of the road as the curbs are also difficult to see.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Telecoms/utilities box covered in graffiti, 12th December
item.description:
The telecoms/utilities boxes on London Rd by the alley to Upper Park Street (opposite Sandford Mill Road junction) is covered in graffiti. London Road is a very busy road so it is seen by many people daily and doesn't give a good impression of the town. It would be great if it could be cleaned off/painted over. There is also graffiti on the wall in the alley but this isn't visible from the road only to people walking through the alley.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 136, London Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Telecoms/Utilities boxes covered in graffiti, 12th December
item.description:
The telecoms/utilities boxes on Hale's Rd close to junction with King's Rd are covered in graffiti. Hale's Road is a busy road so it is seen by many people daily and doesn't give a good impression of the town. It would be great if it could be cleaned off/painted over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Hales Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 12th December
item.description:
Drainage cover with metal grid, it is badly corroded and bits are falling off it, there is very little of it left and could be a safety hazard for road users. Customer states it has been this way for years but the cover/grate may need replacing and does not think its an emergency.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole outside nursery, and another 7 along Lane., 12th December
item.description:
Deep pothole outside Greenway Nursery on Greenway Lane is one of many resulting from water running down the Lane from above the Greenway Hotel where there is no ditch and fly tipping has blocked run-off into ditch on the other side.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenway Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
